page.title: 17FARMING-AGRICULTURAL COLLEGE
page.content: The largest acreage in this part of E. Cornwall is held,under tennancy from the Duchy of Cornwall,by Cornwall County Council as an Agricultural College.This was formed in September 1984 having been farmed until then by Duchy Home Farm.Of 45o acres, about 12o acres of grass are intensively cultivated for silage and 16 acres cut as hay.6o acres are under grain.1o acres grow main crop potatoes. The remainder is pasture.No milk quota was available,and a herd of 8o cows is milked at Westcoobeshead in a modern 12/12 herringbone unit.A flock of 45o sheep is grazed.Bullocks are kept in the traditional way of part grazing, part yarding.but an innovation is the establishment of a shed where animals are housed from 6 weeks old until marketting at 2 years old.The acreage shown is not all in the survey area.
